title: Focused Ion Beam Milling of Soft Materials for Improved Sample Preparation
content: In recent decades, the application of focused ion beam (FIB) milling to soft materials in addition to material science applications has gained particular interest to avoid distortions resulted by mechanical cutting processes such as microtomy sectioning [1]. In the case of FIB milling, the quality of the prepared samples depends on the interaction of the ions with the target substrate. Therefore, optimizing the milling parameters becomes crucial for smooth and consistent sample preparation. Either for volume imaging by SEM/FIB tomography, lamella preparation for high-resolution TEM imaging, or for nanoscale x-ray microscopy analysis, minimizing FIB-induced artifacts while maximizing data collection and sample preparation efficiency is essential. Therefore, optimizing the milling conditions becomes crucial for reliable sample preparation.
